array.string: President Franklin Delano Roosevelt passes away after four momentous terms in office, leaving Vice President Harry S. Truman in charge of a country
Adolf Hitler commits suicide as he knows Germany has lost the war.
Germany officially surrendered to the Allies, bringing an end to the European conflict in World War II. General Alfred Jodl, signed the unconditional surrender of both east and west forces
The United States drops the Atomic Bomb on Hiroshima
The explosion wiped out 90 percent of the city and immediately killed 80,000 people; tens of thousands more would later die of radiation exposure.
Another atomic bomb is dropped on Nagasaki, Japan.
Japan surrenders to US General Douglass MacArthur and the Allies.
